solution_line_template: Following her rule, Gail keeps {second_tank_gallons} / {fish_size_second_tank} = <<{second_tank_gallons}/{fish_size_second_tank}={fish_in_second_tank}>>{fish_in_second_tank} two-inch fish in the second tank.
She keeps {first_tank_gallons} / {fish_size_first_tank} = <<{first_tank_gallons}/{fish_size_first_tank}={initial_fish_in_first_tank}>>{initial_fish_in_first_tank} fish in the first tank.

If one fish in the first tank ate another, she would have {initial_fish_in_first_tank} - {eaten_fish} = <<{initial_fish_in_first_tank}-{eaten_fish}={fish_in_first_tank_after_eating}>>{fish_in_first_tank_after_eating} fish in the first tank.

Thus, Gail would have {fish_in_first_tank_after_eating} - {fish_in_second_tank} = <<{fish_in_first_tank_after_eating}-{fish_in_second_tank}={more_fish_in_first_tank}>>{more_fish_in_first_tank} more fish in the first tank.
